1.name: In a Lonely Place
1.description: A potentially violent screenwriter is a murder suspect until his lovely neighbor clears him. But she begins to have doubts.

2.name: Sunset Blvd.
2.description: A screenwriter is hired to rework a faded silent film star's script, only to find himself developing a dangerous relationship.

3.name: All About Eve
3.description: An ingenue insinuates herself into the company of an established but aging stage actress and her circle of theater friends.

4.name: Cinderella
4.description: When Cinderella's cruel stepmother prevents her from attending the Royal Ball, she gets some unexpected help from the lovable mice Gus and Jaq, and from her Fairy Godmother.

5.name: The Asphalt Jungle
5.description: A major heist goes off as planned, until bad luck and double crosses cause everything to unravel.

6.name: Rashômon
6.description: The rape of a bride and the murder of her samurai husband are recalled from the perspectives of a bandit, the bride, the samurai's ghost and a woodcutter.

7.name: Harvey
7.description: Due to his insistence that he has an invisible six foot-tall rabbit for a best friend, a whimsical middle-aged man is thought by his family to be insane - but he may be wiser than anyone knows.

8.name: The Yellow Cab Man
8.description: Pirdy is accident prone. He has been denied insurance from every company in town because he is always getting hit or hurt in some way. On the day that he meets the lovely Ellen of the ...                See full summary »

9.name: Broken Arrow
9.description: Tom Jeffords tries to make peace between settlers and Apaches in Arizona territory.

10.name: Rio Grande
10.description: A cavalry officer posted on the Rio Grande must deal with murderous raiding Apaches, his son who's a risk-taking recruit and his wife from whom he has been separated for many years.

11.name: The Black Rose
11.description: A disinherited 13th Century Saxon nobleman leaves Norman England with an archer friend to seek his fortune in the Far East.

12.name: The Jackie Robinson Story
12.description: Biography of Jackie Robinson, the first black major league baseball player in the 20th century. Traces his career in the negro leagues and the major leagues.

13.name: The Breaking Point
13.description: An otherwise moral captain of a charter boat becomes financially strapped and is drawn into illegal activities in order to keep up payments on his boat.

14.name: Winchester '73
14.description: The journey of a prized rifle from one ill-fated owner to another parallels a cowboy's search for a murderous fugitive.

15.name: Los olvidados
15.description: A group of juvenile delinquents live a violent and crime-filled life in the festering slums of Mexico City, and the morals of young Pedro are gradually corrupted and destroyed by the others.

16.name: Treasure Island
16.description: The treasure seeking adventures of young Jim Hawkins and pirate captain Long John Silver.

17.name: Destination Moon
17.description: One of the first science fiction films to attempt a high level of accurate technical detail tells the story of the first trip to the Moon.

18.name: Comanche Territory
18.description: White settlers plan to defy the agreement between the government and the Comanche in order to mine for silver on Comanche lands, while scout Jim Bowie tries to keep the peace in the territory.

19.name: Born Yesterday
19.description: A tycoon hires a tutor to teach his lover proper etiquette, with unexpected results.

20.name: Bright Leaf
20.description: In 1894, Brant Royle shocks the aristocratic tobacco growers of Kingsmont by planning to mass-produce cigarettes.

21.name: The Gunfighter
21.description: Notorious gunfighter Jimmy Ringo rides into town to find his true love, who doesn't want to see him. He hasn't come looking for trouble, but trouble finds him around every corner.

22.name: Colt .45
22.description: Gun salesman Steve Farrell gets two of his new Colt .45 pistols stolen from him by ruthless killer Jason Brett but vows to recover them.

23.name: Dallas
23.description: A former Confederate officer hunting for an outlaw who wronged him finds him in Dallas, but now as a wealthy, respectable citizen.

24.name: Gun Crazy
24.description: A well meaning crack shot husband is pressured by his beautiful marksman wife to go on an interstate robbery spree, where he finds out just how depraved and deadly she really is.

25.name: Orphée
25.description: A poet in love with Death follows his unhappy wife into the underworld.

26.name: Annie Get Your Gun
26.description: The story of the great sharpshooter Annie Oakley, who rose to fame while dealing with her love/professional rival, Frank Butler.

27.name: Panic in the Streets
27.description: A doctor and a policeman in New Orleans have only 48 hours to locate a killer infected with pneumonic plague.

28.name: Father of the Bride
28.description: The father of a young woman deals with the emotional pain of her getting married, along with the financial and organizational trouble of arranging the wedding.

29.name: Cheaper by the Dozen
29.description: "Cheaper By the Dozen", based on the real-life story of the Gilbreth family, follows them from Providence, Rhode Island to Montclair, New Jersey, and details the amusing anecdotes found in ...                See full summary »

30.name: Harriet Craig
30.description: Domineering Harriet Craig holds more regard for her home and its possessions than she does for any person in her life. Among those she treats like household objects are her kind husband ...                See full summary »

31.name: The Men
31.description: A paralyzed war vet tries to adjust to the world without the use of his limbs.

32.name: Stage Fright
32.description: A struggling actress tries to help a friend prove his innocence when he's accused of murdering the husband of a high society entertainer.

33.name: Night and the City
33.description: A small-time grifter and nightclub tout takes advantage of some fortuitous circumstances and tries to become a big-time player as a wrestling promoter.

34.name: King Solomon's Mines
34.description: Adventurer Allan Quartermain leads an expedition into uncharted African territory in an attempt to locate an explorer who went missing during his search for the fabled diamond mines of King Solomon.

35.name: Lilli Marlene
35.description: A French girl singer is captured by the Nazis, and made to broadcast for them.

36.name: Caged
36.description: A naive nineteen year old widow becomes coarsened and cynical when she is sent to a woman's prison and is exposed to hardened criminals and sadistic guards.

37.name: Where the Sidewalk Ends
37.description: Det. Sgt. Mark Dixon wants to be something his old man wasn't: a guy on the right side of the law. But Dixon's vicious nature will get the better of him.

38.name: Kiss Tomorrow Goodbye
38.description: Starting with a violent prison break, clever, ruthless Ralph Cotter corrupts everyone around him.

39.name: No Way Out
39.description: A black doctor is assigned to treat two white racist suspects who are brothers, and when one dies, it causes tension that could start a race riot.

40.name: Outrage
40.description: A young woman who has just become engaged has her life completely shattered when she is raped while on her way home from work.

41.name: Paul Temple's Triumph
41.description: A husband-and-wife detective team look into the murder of one of her friends, whose father--a prominent scientist--has been kidnapped. They find themselves up against a sinister crime ...                See full summary »

42.name: Woman on the Run
42.description: Frank Johnson flees police after becoming an eyewitness to murder. He is pursued around scenic San Francisco by his wife, a reporter, the police, and... the real murderer.

43.name: Stromboli, terra di Dio
43.description: Karin, a young woman from the Baltic countries, marries fisherman Antonio to escape from a prison camp. But she cannot get used to the tough life in Antonio's volcano-threatened village, Stromboli.

44.name: Never Fear
44.description: A dancer who has just gotten engaged to her partner and choreographer and is about to embark on a major career is devastated to learn that she has contracted polio.

45.name: Cyrano de Bergerac
45.description: The charismatic swordsman-poet helps another woo the woman he loves in this straightforward version of the play.

46.name: Summer Stock
46.description: A small-town farmer, down on her luck, finds her homestead invaded by a theatrical troupe invited to stay by her ne'er-do-well sister.

47.name: Wagon Master
47.description: Two young drifters guide a Mormon wagon train to the San Juan Valley and encounter cutthroats, Indians, geography, and moral challenges on the journey.

48.name: Young Man with a Horn
48.description: A young trumpeter enjoys highs (musical success, fame, and fortune) and lows (sour marriage, death of his mentor, bout with alcoholism).

49.name: The File on Thelma Jordon
49.description: Assistant district attorney Cleve Marshall falls for the mysterious Thelma Jordon when she seeks help solving robberies of her aunt's estate.

50.name: A Ticket to Tomahawk
50.description: In 1876 Colorado, the Tomahawk and Western Railroad is expanding through the Rockies, but some stagecoach operators, fearing a loss of revenue, plan to sabotage the railroad.
